messages.message: Hi all, quick poll - I’m looking to disable our Travis CI integration in the main Instabase repo since we’ve been running on our Jenkins cluster for a good month now. Is any repo still dependent on Travis? If so let me know and I can selectively enable it there. Thanks!
fyi @zach we might be able to stop paying for Travis soon.
Appengrepo uses it still, albeit we could downgrade the plan @Heymian
can appengrepo move to our Jenkins cluster :wink:

travis is much easier to maintain for us (given the extremely-limited-to-no jenkins experience, jenkins overall complexity, etc.) and its pros (like docker caching, pipelines, etc. ) aren’t valuable to us (appengrepo’s CI isn’t containerized at all, deps are pretty minimal so just re-installed each time, we just don’t need pipelines).
the Blueprint and Foundation repos use Travis
OK, what would it take for us to move everything to Jenkins?  I understand that it is easier to use Travis right now, but in the longer term it makes sense for us to have a consolidated CI system.
